name: StatusEffectHelper
description: The `StatusEffectHelper` class provides a wrapper around Minecraft's status effect instances (potions and effects), allowing scripts to query information about active status effects on entities.
overview:
This helper class provides methods to access all key properties of status effects including their type identifier, amplifier level, remaining duration, visual properties, and categorization. It's commonly used when examining player status effects, monitoring entity effects during combat, or tracking potion effects in automation scripts.

StatusEffectHelper instances are typically obtained through:
- Living entity status effect queries using `LivingEntityHelper.getStatusEffects()`
- Status effect update events when effects are added or removed
- Registry lookups using `RegistryHelper.getStatusEffect()`

constructors.description: Internal constructor that wraps a Minecraft status effect instance.

parameters.name: statusEffectInstance
parameters.description: The underlying Minecraft status effect instance to wrap

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Retrieves the unique identifier (ID) of the status effect (e.g., "minecraft:speed").

methods.name: getStrength
methods.description: Returns the amplifier level of the status effect (0-based, so 0 for level I, 1 for level II, etc.).

methods.name: getTime
methods.description: Returns the remaining duration of the status effect in game ticks (20 ticks = 1 second).

methods.name: getCategory
methods.description: Returns the category of the status effect as a string (e.g., "BENEFICIAL", "HARMFUL", "NEUTRAL").

methods.name: isAmbient
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is ambient, typically originating from sources like beacons or conduits.

methods.name: hasIcon
methods.description: Checks if the status effect has a visible icon in the game's user interface.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is visually visible (e.g., displays particle effects around the entity).

methods.name: isInstant
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is an instant effect (like Instant Health or Instant Damage) rather than a duration-based one.

methods.name: isBeneficial
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as beneficial (e.g., Speed, Strength).

methods.name: isNeutral
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as neutral (e.g., Night Vision).

methods.name: isHarmful
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as harmful (e.g., Poison, Wither).

methods.name: isPermanent
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is considered permanent (often indicated by a very large duration value rather than true permanence).
